summary: This is an email chain from February 8, 2019, discussing coordination regarding Jeffrey Epstein. It involves personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and the Department of Justice's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR), focusing on establishing points of contact for the Epstein matter.

events.title: Coordination on Epstein Matter
events.description: Email correspondence discussing establishing points of contact between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and the DOJ's Office of Professional Responsibility regarding the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated February 8, 2019, concerning Jeffrey Epstein.
It involves coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and the DOJ's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR).
The communication indicates a desire to establish formal points of contact (POCs) between the offices regarding the Epstein matter.
The tone is described as 'perfectly cordial' with OPR stating it does not want to 'get in our way'.
All specific names of individuals (senders, recipients, the 'head of OPR') are redacted in the provided text.
